    • Method Detail

      • encrypt

        public byte[] encrypt​(byte[] aByteArray,
                      byte[] aKeyByteArray)
        Encrypts/decrypts byte array with key.
        Parameters:
        aByteArray - Byte array
        aKeyByteArray - Key byte array
        Returns:
        Encrypted/decrypted byte array with same length as aByteArray or null if encrypted byte array could not be created

      • getPercent

        public int getPercent​(int aCurrentValue,
                      int aTotalValue)
        Returns fraction aCurrentValue of aTotalValue in percent (0 to 100, without decimals)
        Parameters:
        aCurrentValue - Current value
        aTotalValue - Total value
        Returns:
        Fraction aCurrentValue of aTotalValue in percent (0 to 100, without decimals) or -1 if fraction can not be calculated

      • getPercentWithMax99

        public int getPercentWithMax99​(int aCurrentValue,
                               int aTotalValue)
        Returns fraction aCurrentValue of aTotalValue in percent (0 to 99, without decimals). NOTE: Maximum return value is 99, also if 100 percent is determined.
        Parameters:
        aCurrentValue - Current value
        aTotalValue - Total value
        Returns:
        Fraction aCurrentValue of aTotalValue in percent (0 to 99, without decimals) or -1 if fraction can not be calculated

      • cutDoubleValue

        public double cutDoubleValue​(double aValue,
                             int aNumberOfDecimals)
        Cuts aValue after specified number of decimals. NOTE: No checks are performed.
        Parameters:
        aValue - Value
        aNumberOfDecimals - Number of decimals
        Returns:
        Rounded value

      • getRadiusOfParticlesInDpdBox

        public double getRadiusOfParticlesInDpdBox​(int aNumberOfParticles,
                                           double aDpdDensity)
        Calculates the radius of a sphere in DPD units with specified number of particles in the DPD simulation box
        Parameters:
        aNumberOfParticles - Number of particles
        aDpdDensity - DPD density
        Returns:
        Radius of a sphere with specified number of particles in the DPD simulation box or 0.0 if radius can not be calculated

        public int getNumberOfElementsOfJaggedArrayOfStrings​(java.lang.String[][] aJaggedArrayOfStrings)
        Returns number of elements in specified jagged array of strings
        Parameters:
        aJaggedArrayOfStrings - Jagged array of strings
        Returns:
        Number of elements in specified jagged array of strings (if no strings are found zero is returned)

      • removeElementFromStringArray

        public java.lang.String[] removeElementFromStringArray​(java.lang.String[] aStringArray,
                                                       java.lang.String anElementToBeRemoved)
        Removes specified element from string array
        Parameters:
        aStringArray - String array (is NOT changed but may be returned, see code)
        anElementToBeRemoved - String element to be removed
        Returns:
        New array where specified element is removed (may be a String array of length 0 if all elements of aStringArray had to be removed)

      • removeUpToElementFromStringArray

        public java.lang.String[] removeUpToElementFromStringArray​(java.lang.String[] aStringArray,
                                                           java.lang.String anElementToBeRemovedUpToInclusive)
        Removes elements up to (inclusive!) specified element from string array
        Parameters:
        aStringArray - String array (is NOT changed but may be returned, see code)
        anElementToBeRemovedUpToInclusive - String element to be removed up to inclusive
        Returns:
        New array where up to (inclusive!) specified element is removed (may be a String array of length 0 if all elements of aStringArray had to be removed)

      • removeFirstElementFromStringArray

        public java.lang.String[] removeFirstElementFromStringArray​(java.lang.String[] aStringArray)
        Removes first element from string array
        Parameters:
        aStringArray - String array (is NOT changed)
        Returns:
        New array where first element is removed (may be null if aStringArray is null or has length less/equal 1)

      • removeLastElementFromStringArray

        public java.lang.String[] removeLastElementFromStringArray​(java.lang.String[] aStringArray)
        Removes last element from string array
        Parameters:
        aStringArray - String array (is NOT changed)
        Returns:
        New array where last element is removed (may be null if aStringArray is null or has length less/equal 1)

      • containsElement

        public boolean containsElement​(java.lang.String[] aStringArray,
                               java.lang.String anElement)
        Returns if aStringArray contains anElement
        Parameters:
        aStringArray - String array
        anElement - Element
        Returns:
        True: aStringArray contains anElement, false: Otherwise

      • areStringArraysEqual

        public boolean areStringArraysEqual​(java.lang.String[] aStringArray1,
                                    java.lang.String[] aStringArray2)
        Returns if both string arrays have equal strings. NOTE: If one of the arrays is null or has length 0 false is returned.
        Parameters:
        aStringArray1 - String array 1
        aStringArray2 - String array 2
        Returns:
        True: Both arrays have equal strings, false: Otherwise

      • getIndexStringArray

        public java.lang.String[] getIndexStringArray​(int anUpperIndex)
        Returns index string array according to upper index, i.e. {"1", "2", "3"} for anUpperIndex = 3.
        Parameters:
        anUpperIndex - Upper index
        Returns:
        Index string array or null if anUpperIndex is less than 1.

      • sortGenericArray

        public <T> void sortGenericArray​(T[] anArray,
                                 java.util.Comparator<T> aComparator)
        Sorts array according to aComparator. Implements "Heapsort" algorithm based on W.H. Press et al., Numerical recipes in FORTRAN 77, Cambridge University Press, 1992
        Type Parameters:
        T - Object provided comparator class
        Parameters:
        anArray - Array to be sorted (may be null then nothing is done)
        aComparator - Comparator class for objects of anArray

      • sortGenericArray

        public <T> void sortGenericArray​(T[] anArray,
                                 int anArrayLength,
                                 java.util.Comparator<T> aComparator)
        Sorts array according to aComparator. Implements "Heapsort" algorithm based on W.H. Press et al., Numerical recipes in FORTRAN 77, Cambridge University Press, 1992
        Type Parameters:
        T - Object provided comparator class
        Parameters:
        anArray - Array to be sorted (may be null then nothing is done, length must be greater/equal to anArrayLength)
        anArrayLength - Length of initial part of anArray to be sorted
        aComparator - Comparator class for objects of anArray
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if anArrayLength is greater than length of anArray

      • getRandomNumberGenerator

        public java.util.Random getRandomNumberGenerator​(long aRandomSeed)
        Returns random number generator with defined seed
        Parameters:
        aRandomSeed - Random seed value
        Returns:
        Random number generator
